data.title: Ivy League Football Media Day Participants Announced
data.meta_description: PRINCETON, N.J. – The 2024 Ivy League Football Media Day will be held virtually on Monday, August 12, beginning at 11 a.m.
data.text:
PRINCETON, N.J. – The 2024 Ivy League Football Media Day will be held virtually on Monday, August 12, beginning at 11 a.m.

The program will once again be hosted by former Yale football star Jack Ford, who provides color commentary for linear Ivy League football games on ESPN networks. The program will begin with opening comments from Ivy League Executive Director Robin Harris and then move into remarks from each of the league's eight head coaches as well as two student-athletes from each institution.

The event will be live streamed on YouTube and can be viewed here.

BROWN

Isaiah Reed (Sr., DB – Tampa, Fla.)

Jake Willcox (5th, QB – Everett, Mass.)

COLUMBIA

CJ Brown (Sr., LB – Houston, Texas)

Bryson Canty (Sr., WR – Pfafftown, N.C.)

CORNELL

Damon Barnes (Sr., LB – The Bronx, N.Y.)

Jameson Wang (Sr., QB – El Segundo, Calif.)

DARTMOUTH

Braden Mullen (Sr., LB – Glenview, Ill.)

Jackson Proctor (Sr., QB – Kent, Wash.)

HARVARD

Eric Little (Sr., LB – Atlanta, Ga.)

Shane McLaughlin (Sr., RB – Monmouth Beach, N.J.)

PENN

Shiloh Means (Sr., DB – Indianapolis, Ind.)

Aidan Sayin (Sr., QB – Carlsbad, Calif.)

PRINCETON

Nicholas Hilliard (Sr., OL – Darrow, La.)

Collin Taylor (Sr., DL – North Andover, Mass.)

YALE

Dean Shaffer (Sr., LB – Smithtown, N.Y.)

Ry Yates (Sr., TE – Vienna, Va.)

The schedule for the day is as follows:

Welcome - 11-11:05 a.m.

Brown - 11:05 - 11:25 a.m.

Columbia - 11:25 - 11:45 a.m.

Cornell - 11:45 a.m. - 12:05 p.m.

Dartmouth - 12:05 - 12:25 p.m.

Harvard - 12:25 - 12:45 p.m.

Penn - 12:45 - 1:05 p.m.

Princeton - 1:05 - 1:25 p.m.

Yale - 1:25 - 1:45 p.m.

The 2024 Ivy League football season kicks off on Saturday, Sept. 21, with six games to appear on ESPN linear networks throughout the season. All Ivy League home games not appearing in the ESPN linear package will air on ESPN+ and select games will also simulcast on regional sports networks.
